info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 3 at 3:58AM CDT until June 3 at 4:30AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of central and south central Nebraska, including the following counties, in central Nebraska, Sherman. In south central Nebraska, Buffalo and Dawson.
* WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 358 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Wiggle Creek, South Loup River, Turkey Creek, Platte River, Cedar Creek, Sweet Creek, Bell Creek, North Channel Platte River, Dry Creek, Clear Creek, Beaver Creek, Rock Creek, Johnson Lake Area, Plum Creek, Swenson Creek, Rusco Creek, Wood River, Spring Creek, Mud Creek, Deer Creek, Middle Loup River, Spring Branch Creek, Gallagher Canyon State Recreation Area, Sand Creek, Buffalo Creek, Elm Creek, Oak Creek and Bloody Run Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lexington, Ravenna, Elm Creek, Overton, Odessa, Pleasanton, Litchfield, Amherst, Riverdale, Rockville, Hazard and Poole. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Buffalo, NE; Dawson, NE; Sherman, NE
